articleinfo.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Alarm Pinger

answer.para: Alarm pinger is a tool for network monitoring. It test periodically reachability of one of more network devices and the quality of their network connetions.

question.para: Can Alarm Pinger be user to monitor services?

answer.para: No. The only way Alarm Pinger monitor things is sending ICMP echo-requests and analyzing ICMP echo-replies. So only host reachability is tested.

question.para: Can Alarm Pinger use TCP/UDP/anything instead of ICMP for pinging?

answer.para: No. It just do plain ICMP echo queries.

question.para: Why can't I use hostnames for target names?

answer.para: Because it would be very hard to interpret results if the hostname resolves to more than one IP address.
